Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (South Ionian?) pottery bowl; very micaceous clay; interior: glazed orange with remains of added lines below rim and on lower wall; exterior: band at top of lip and on wall, the rest reserved; inscription cut on exterior, in reserved zone.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 322)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 670, no. 283)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.853)
